docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs

docs.text: mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.
docs.title: Commands

docs.text: mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Project layout

docs.text: Logic functinos for calculator add ( lval , rval ) Add values Parameters: Name Type Description Default lval int left value required rval int right value required Returns: Name Type Description ret int lval + rval Examples: >>> ret = add ( 1 , 2 ) >>> ret 3 mul ( lval , rval ) Multiply values Parameters: Name Type Description Default lval int left value required rval int right value required Returns: Name Type Description ret int lval * rval Examples: >>> ret = mul ( 2 , 3 ) >>> ret 6 sub ( lval , rval ) Subtract values Parameters: Name Type Description Default lval int left value required rval int right value required Returns: Name Type Description ret int lval - rval Examples: >>> ret = sub ( 1 , 2 ) >>> ret -1
docs.title: Calculator

docs.text: Add values Parameters: Name Type Description Default lval int left value required rval int right value required Returns: Name Type Description ret int lval + rval Examples: >>> ret = add ( 1 , 2 ) >>> ret 3
docs.title: add()

docs.text: Multiply values Parameters: Name Type Description Default lval int left value required rval int right value required Returns: Name Type Description ret int lval * rval Examples: >>> ret = mul ( 2 , 3 ) >>> ret 6
docs.title: mul()

docs.text: Subtract values Parameters: Name Type Description Default lval int left value required rval int right value required Returns: Name Type Description ret int lval - rval Examples: >>> ret = sub ( 1 , 2 ) >>> ret -1
docs.title: sub()
